update.description:
A previous pull request made the --output-label option control the output of the viterbi task, and this makes it work with the posterior task as well. In my testing this does not change segway's behavior unless the posterior task is specified, and output-label is not set to "seg". In sublabel output mode, the labels are printed according to the option in the posterior_code file, and separate posterior bed (and bedGraph) files are created for each sublabel. The "full" output mode (e.g. "0.1" for label 0 sublabel 1) seems a bit confusing for the bedGraph filenames, which already have periods in them, so I set the filenames to just be by sublabel (so for 2 labels and 2 sublabels, the bed files have names 0 through 3).

There is a minor change to a couple touchstone files to account for the fact that the num_subsegs variable is now passed to segway-task.
update.title: posterior compatibility with sublabel output mode

content.raw: A very minor point (which happens throughout and may not need to be changed at all) is it is helpful if possible to state conditionals in the positive. In this case if I can't recall what other options other than 'seg' are available I have no idea what set of values it's supposed to be matching in order to understand the reasoning behind the decision being made. It would be even simpler to read if the conditional order was switched so the positive of what happens when it does match 'seg' is first, then the 'else'.
content.html: A very minor point (which happens throughout and may not need to be changed at all) is it is helpful if possible to state conditionals in the positive. In this case if I can't recall what other options other than 'seg' are available I have no idea what set of values it's supposed to be matching in order to understand the reasoning behind the decision being made. It would be even simpler to read if the conditional order was switched so the positive of what happens when it does match 'seg' is first, then the 'else'.
